ptxt.intxrefpoff: Front Wheel Hub Assembly and Steering Knuckle Components

s1.ptxt: Remove Front wheel hub assembly referring to Front Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation .
Disconnect tie-rod end from steering knuckle referring to Step 2) to 3) of “Removal” in Tie-Rod End Removal and Installation .
Disconnect front height sensor (if equipped) from suspension control arm for left side referring to Height Sensor Removal and Installation (If Equipped) .
Remove wheel speed sensor from knuckle.
Remove steering knuckle ball joint nut then remove strut bracket bolts and nut.
Disconnect ball joint from steering knuckle with puller and then remove steering knuckle.

servinfosub.title: Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Suspension Control Arm / Steering Knuckle Check

servinfosub.ptxt: For installation, reverse removal procedure, noting the following instructions.

s1.ptxt: Connect steering knuckle to suspension control arm.
Install strut bracket bolts (2) and nuts (1) as shown in figure.
Tighten strut bracket nuts (1) to specified torque.
Tighten new suspension control arm ball joint nut (1) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: Never reuse the removed suspension control arm ball joint nut.

torqueitem.t-part: Suspension control arm ball joint nut

s1.ptxt: Install front wheel speed sensor (2) and tighten wheel speed sensor bolt (3).
Connect front height sensor (if equipped) to suspension control arm for left side referring to Height Sensor Removal and Installation (If Equipped) .
Connect tie-rod end to steering knuckle referring to Tie-Rod End Removal and Installation .
Install front wheel and tighten wheel nuts to specified torque.
Install front wheel hub assembly and dust cover to steering knuckle referring to Front Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation .
Check front wheel alignment adjust it as necessary. For check and adjustment procedures, refer to Front Wheel Alignment Inspection and Adjustment .
Adjust headlight auto levering system (if equipped), refer to Initialization of Headlight Auto Leveling System .
